titlestmt.titleproper: Eleakin T. Robb specifications for steamships 1854-1891
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Eleakin T. Robb specifications for steamships
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Eleakin T. Robb was an engineer in Baltimore, Maryland.

scopecontent.p: This volume is an engineer's notebook listing specifications of steamships and their component parts, such as dimensions of hulls and engines. There are entries detailing the distribution of power and performance of various engines built by Reaney, Son, and Co, Miller and Allen, and other shipbuilders. There are also descriptions of other structures, such as bridges and boilers. The volume includes charts and diagrams.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.
